meanings.definition: Belonging to a period other than the one being portrayed
meanings.sent1: The anachronic costumes in the play confused the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her anachronic hairstyle stood out in the modern fashion show.
meanings.sent3: The anachronic knight tried to use a smartphone in the medieval castle.
meanings.sent4: His anachronic beliefs were like ancient relics in a fast-paced world.
meanings.sent5: The anachronic music transported me to a bygone era.

meanings.sent1: The anachronic technology was no match for the new inventions.
meanings.sent2: She wore an anachronic dress to the retro-themed party.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's anachronic jokes always made us smile.
meanings.sent4: Her anachronic taste in music was like listening to history.
meanings.sent5: The anachronic decor of the restaurant felt like a trip back in time.
